FuncDef:
The efm enable command enables EFM OAM in the virtual access port-extension view.
The undo efm enable command disables EFM OAM in the virtual access port-extension view.
By default, EFM OAM is disabled in the virtual access port-extension view.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To implement continuity check, fault monitoring, remote fault notification, and remote loopback functions for the link between directly connected devices, configure EFM OAM.
In virtual access port-extension scenarios, EFM OAM can be applied between a CE and AP that are directly connected to ensure the reliability and stability of connections between user and carrier networks.
Precautions
You can perform EFM OAM operations only after enabling EFM OAM in the virtual access port-extension view.
After the undo efm enable command is run in the virtual access port-extension view to disable EFM OAM, an AP automatically deletes all EFM OAM configurations.
